intro: Toxocarpus eriocarpus, commonly known as the woolly fruit shrub, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Toxocarpus eriocarpus thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
